statement: The idea of integrating peptidisc membrane mimetic system into thermal proteome profiling (MM-TPP) for characterizing membrane protein-ligand interactions is appealing and potentially useful.

It would be inaccurate to make the claim that MM-TPP completely circumvents structural perturbations invoked by detergents, because membrane fractions are initially solubilized by 1% DDM for at least 45 minutes before peptidisc reconstitution.

It is less likely that all structural perturbations caused by DDM to membrane proteins and their transient interactions become completely reversed by peptidisc reconstitution, making potential claims about preserving low-affinity interactions questionable.

The method would benefit from testing detergents that are milder and harsher than 1% DDM to demonstrate that peptidisc reconstitution can rescue perturbations caused by detergents during solubilization.
The story requires a stronger and broader demonstration of the ability of peptidisc-TPP to identify novel physiologically/pharmacologically relevant interactions in membrane proteins.
